page.title: 19Life Styles: Children
page.content: We visited Cholsey school to discoever apossible about the {life style} of 20th. Century children. We asked 57 children aged 10 and 11 a series of questions about {transport, food, pets, power, hobbies and pastimes, games and general information.} We found that 22 families (38.5%) had one private car, 25 families (43.8%) had two private cars and only 5 families (8.75%) had no car. The main sources of energy for heatng homes was gas 15.8%, electricity 66.6%, oil 7.0%, solid fuel 10.5%. The most popular games were rugby 7.0% (all boys), football 35% (all boys) swimming 14% (4 boys 4 girls) netball 14% (all girls) roller skating 12.2% (all girls). 70% of the children lived less than 1km from school and all but 5 of them normally walk to school. 5 others came by car and 12 walked. 54% had less than 1 pound a week for pocket money.
